title: Companies Are Scrapping Their Plans for Fall
summary: The fast-spreading Delta variant has managers revamping schedules, with bosses delaying office reopenings and canceling events. Up until a few weeks ago, corporate leaders felt confident about what to expect this fall.

title: Bobby Bowden, Legendary Florida State Football Coach, Dies at 91
summary: The Hall of Famer won more than 350 games and two national championships during his 40 years as a major college coach. Bobby Bowden, the folksy Hall of Fame coach who built Florida State into a college football dynasty that powered its way to a dozen conference titles and two national championships, died early Sunday. He was 91.

title: Your Cat or Your House Plants. There's Room for Only One.
summary: Owners who find their furry friends have a knack for destroying their flora are looking for ways to keep them apart. Adam Kopley couldn't figure out what was killing the spider plant he brought home in May. The culprit turned out to be sleeping under his own roof.

title: Cash Is Flooding Into Short-Term Markets Like Never Before
summary: Wall Street is watching for signs of broader financial stress as trillions of dollars change hands every night in reverse and repo markets. An unusual surge of short-term lending by cash-rich companies is raising concerns on Wall Street that a period of unrest may lie ahead.

title: Local Vaccine Mandates Needed to Fight Covid-19, U.S. Officials Say
summary: Public-health officials' comments come as head of powerful teachers union and some businesses endorse vaccine requirements amid spread of Delta variant. WASHINGTON-Top U.S. public-health officials on Sunday voiced support for Covid-19 vaccination mandates imposed at the local level, while the head of a national teachers union also backed such a move in schools.

title: Anti-Semitism Isn't Merely Another Kind of Hate
summary: People organize against the Jews as part of an ideological struggle.. Israeli Foreign Minister Yair Lapid startled the Conference Against Antisemitism in Jerusalem last month by redefining the term: "The anti-Semites weren't only in the Budapest ghetto," he said. They were also "the slave traders," the Hutus who committed genocide in Rwanda, "those Muslims who have killed more than 20 million fellow Muslims in the past decade," and "those who beat young LGBT people to death."

title: The Trillion-Dollar Infrastructure Bill Will Fuel Inflation
summary: Policy makers are leaning forward with stimulus as favorable economic winds blow at their backs.. The 2,702-page, trillion-dollar infrastructure bill under consideration in Congress is a monumental feat of bipartisan negotiation, but if passed, it will likely heap more fuel on the inflation fire.

title: Labor Lost a Great One in Richard Trumka
summary: We were adversaries, sometimes allies, but always with a healthy respect for each other.. Richard Trumka, president of the AFL-CIO, died Thursday at 72. I knew him well. Throughout Rich's 12 years as the head of organized labor in Washington, I worked two blocks away as head of the U.S. Chamber of Commerce. Our causes were often in fierce opposition, but Rich and I never were.

title: Save Speed Reading for Emergencies
summary: A slow ramble through pages is more pleasurable and leaves a deep memory.. As another summer reading season nears its end, I'm struck again by how few books I've finished. As a journalist who often has to read on deadline, I've learned how to go through books at a clip. But when I read just for me, I take my sweet time. The teetering column of volumes on my nightstand right now, which includes everything from Malcolm Gladwell's "The Bomber Mafia" to Roger Rosenblatt's "Cold Moon" to Alec Lobrano's "My Place at the Table," is a monument to my happy, glacial pace.

title: Peru May Join Cuba's Authoritarian Axis
summary: Leftist President Pedro Castillo is trying to provoke a crisis so he can seize power.. Guerrillas slaughtered 16 people in a south-central Peruvian village in May. The BBC reported "the bodies had bullet holes" according to a local official, and some, "including those of two children, had been burned."

title: 'Book Wars' Review: Publishing in a Protean Age
summary: The tumult that has overtaken the publishing industry invites comparisons to Gutenberg, but paperbacks were a revolution of their own.. In 2000 the RAND Corporation invited a group of historians-including me-to address a newly pressing question: Would digital media revolutionize society as profoundly as Gutenberg and movable type? Two decades later, John Thompson's answer is yes, but not entirely as predicted. And our forecasts were often wrong because we overlooked key variables: We cannot understand the impact of technologies "without taking account of the complex social processes in which these technologies were embedded and of which they were part."

title: Taliban Seize Key Target Kunduz, Other North Afghanistan Cities
summary: Resume Subscription. KABUL-Afghan government defenses collapsed in key cities in northern Afghanistan, as the Taliban seized the strategic hub of Kunduz and overran two other provincial capitals, taking advantage of the American military withdrawal.

title: Schools Reopen to Mask Confusion
summary: Resume Subscription. When students in California and Illinois head back to school in a few weeks, they will have to wear masks. Florida and Arizona, meanwhile, banned mask requirements in schools. Some, but not all, districts there are insisting on them anyway.

title: Student Loan Forbearance-Forever?
summary: Biden gives borrowers more time not to repay. Debt cancellation may be next.. The pandemic has become an excuse for progressives to impose policies they otherwise couldn't-from new entitlements to a ban on rental evictions. The latest act of executive hubris came late Friday when President Biden extended student loan forbearance through January.

title: Joe Manchin's Inflation Risk
summary: He warns the Fed, but the Senator's spending is part of the problem.. Democrats are starting to notice that mounting inflation might derail their electoral prospects next year, and none are noticing more than Joe Manchin of West Virginia. The Senate's most important swing vote last week became the first Democratic lawmaker to warn the Federal Reserve about rising prices.

title: The Taliban Advance Escalates in Afghanistan
summary: Biden's precipitous withdrawal is quickly becoming a debacle.. Biden Administration officials continue to insist that diplomacy is the only solution in Afghanistan. The Taliban has other ideas as its military advance continues over ever more Afghan territory and targets government officials who worked with the U.S.

title: Economy Week Ahead: Inflation, GDP, Jobless Claims
summary: U.S. Labor Department's report on July consumer prices is the focus of this week's economic data. The U.S. Labor Department's report on July consumer prices is the focus of this week's economic data.

title: Silence and Fear Follow Afghan City's Fall
summary: Residents of Kunduz are hiding in basements and desperate to flee, as power is out and cellphones die. KABUL-For two days, the Taliban battled Afghan government forces in the northern city of Kunduz, edging closer to its center. As shopkeeper Abdul Wahid ventured out for morning prayers on Sunday, he spotted Taliban fighters closing in on key government buildings.

title: Biden's Electric-Car Ambitions Face Real-World Roadblocks
summary: Auto makers want congressional moves on charging stations and tax incentives; consumer support also is needed. WASHINGTON-President Biden wants to convert American motorists to electric cars as a linchpin of his plan to address climate change. Success heavily depends on factors outside his control.

title: Belarus's Lukashenko Tightens His Grip a Year After Disputed Election
summary: With Russia's support, the leader has withstood pressure at home and abroad since opponents accused him of stealing last year's presidential vote. MINSK, Belarus-For months after Belarusian leader Alexander Lukashenko declared himself the victor in presidential elections last year, hundreds of thousands of protesters thronged the streets in weekly protests accusing him of rigging the result.

title: New York Lt. Gov. Kathy Hochul Prepares for a Cuomo Resignation
summary: She sought advice on first steps in office, whom to hire and which members of current administration might stay on if Gov. Cuomo resigns or is impeached. In phone calls last week, New York Lt. Gov. Kathy Hochul sought advice on potential first steps in office, as well as whom to hire and which members of Gov. Andrew Cuomo's administration might stay on if he resigned or was removed from office, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Tesla to Require Masks at Nevada Battery Factory
summary: The Silicon Valley electric-vehicle maker joins others in tightening at-work guidelines to safeguard against Covid-19. Tesla Inc. is telling workers at its Nevada battery factory they will be required to wear a mask indoors starting Monday regardless of vaccination status, joining the growing number of companies with such mandates as Covid-19 cases rise.

title: Sexual-Assault Allegation at Alibaba Triggers Outrage, Investigation
summary: Police looking into woman's accusation against her then-supervisor; Chinese e-commerce giant's CEO says he's 'furious' in internal message. An allegation of sexual assault against a manager at Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. has sparked a firestorm of public criticism, prompting Chief Executive Daniel Zhang to intervene in a situation that has stirred questions about sexual harassment in Chinese workplaces.

title: The Case Against Masks for Children
summary: It's abusive to force kids who struggle with them to sacrifice for the sake of unvaccinated adults.. Do masks reduce Covid transmission in children? Believe it or not, we could find only a single retrospective study on the question, and its results were inconclusive. Yet two weeks ago the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention sternly decreed that 56 million U.S. children and adolescents, vaccinated or not, should cover their faces regardless of the prevalence of infection in their community. Authorities in many places took the cue to impose mandates in schools and elsewhere, on the theory that masks can't do any harm.

title: To Lie Is Human
summary: Children are often honest, but when I asked my son to fib about his age, he did.. We all tell lies. Some are forced: "It must have gone to my spam folder." Others mislead: "15 days to flatten the curve." Some are corrupt: "You can keep your doctor." Others are dangerous: "mostly peaceful protests" and "destruction is not violence." Have we finally gone overboard with all the lying?

title: Bipartisan Infrastructure Deal Raises Taxes
summary: Calling it a 'targeted corporate user fee' doesn't change the reality.. Regarding "A Not So Grand Infrastructure Deal" (Review & Outlook, July 30): We agree that the bill's "pay-fors" deserve a closer look. In particular, we're troubled to hear some of the bipartisan deal's supporters call the reinstated Superfund taxes "targeted corporate user fees," and others say it doesn't increase taxes.

title: What the Wealth-Inequality Statistics Leave Out
summary: The exclusion of Social Security and pensions distorts the data and financial-aid decisions that rely on it.. The study cited in your editorial demonstrates that the inclusion of Social Security and defined-benefit pensions reduces wealth inequality significantly ("A Distorted View of Wealth Inequality," Review & Outlook, July 31). It should have gone further by including Medicare, which is conceptually similar: You pay into the system now with the expectation of receiving benefits later. Although Medicare's present value for an individual is difficult to calculate, its inclusion would reduce inequality even further.

title: No U.S. Subsidies for Dirty Solar Panels Made in China
summary: The policy has failed American workers and the environment.. American policy, which incentivizes our consumers to purchase China-made solar panels manufactured with inexpensive coal power by low-wage workers, has decimated the U.S. solar industry, made us dependent on an adversary for critical energy infrastructure, and failed as climate policy, given that China is increasing carbon emissions faster than we can reduce them ("Coal Plays Key Role in Making Chinese Panels," U.S. News, Aug. 2). I will soon introduce legislation to restrict generous federal solar tax credits to panels manufactured at each stage with majority-U.S. inputs. My bill also will require disclosing to consumers the percentage of fossil fuels used to manufacture each brand of solar modules, so environmentally conscious buyers don't become unwitting subsidizers of fossil fuels.

title: The U.S. National Debt Is Not a Free Lunch
summary: There will come a time when the bond vigilantes say 'enough' and the federal budget is thrown into chaos.. Gordon Gekko said that greed is good. Robert de Porres-Ras claims that debt is good (Letters, Aug. 4). You can carry a lot of debt with the 10-year Treasury bond at 1.25%, but we have negative interest rates with inflation over 5%. The holder of that Treasury is losing buying power every day. There will come a time when the bond vigilantes say "enough" and the national budget will be thrown into chaos.

title: Don't Mess With Jim Jordan
summary: Anyone attempting to kick the Ohio congressman would quickly find himself staring at the ceiling of the gymnasium.. Lance Morrow misses the best possible punchline in "'Kicking Jim Jordan' Isn't Healthy-Even at the Gym" (op-ed, Aug. 5). Rep. Jordan was a two-time NCAA Division I wrestling champion for the University of Wisconsin and a wrestling coach at Ohio State. As a former college wrestler of less talent, I can assure you that anyone attempting to kick Mr. Jordan would quickly find himself staring at the ceiling of the gymnasium.

title: Beirut Port Explosion Fuels Lebanon's Collapse
summary: Resume Subscription. BEIRUT-In recent decades Lebanon has been a place of relative calm in a turbulent region. Now it is living through a once-in-a-century economic meltdown.

title: Cuba Protests Spark Midterm Election Maneuvering in Florida
summary: Democrats are seeking to avoid a repeat of 2020 losses as they face Republican criticism of their policies toward the communist country. The historic wave of protests in Cuba last month against the communist regime has triggered a political battle in Florida to define the Biden administration's response, with Democrats hoping to avoid further losses among Latino voters in the electorally crucial state.

title: A Gold Mine Takeover Highlights Increasing Mining-Sector Risk
summary: In Kyrgyzstan, the government seized a large mine owned by Canada's Centerra Gold; the company now faces an uphill battle to get it back. Canada's Centerra Gold Inc. invested more than $3 billion over nearly three decades to turn a remote gold prospect in Kyrgyzstan into a prosperous gold mine. Then in May, the mine was taken over by authorities in the former Soviet republic.

title: Movie Theater Recovery in a Holding Pattern
summary: Cinemark, IMAX results show moviegoers are returning, but hardly in droves. Movie-theater operators have the easiest comparisons imaginable this earnings season, but those numbers aren't saying much.

title: REITs Are Back in Vogue as Real-Estate Market Makes a Comeback
summary: The 35 REIT exchange-traded funds hold $87 billion in assets. Real-estate investment trusts, often thought of primarily as a way to diversify a portfolio, are playing a starring role this year.

title: Dour Olympics Ends After Battle With Covid-19, Japanese Public
summary: Officials tout lack of major outbreak as sign that they pulled off the strangest Games ever. TOKYO-The Tokyo Olympics came to an end with the closing ceremony for the Games on Sunday after 17 days in which the world's biggest sporting event coped with a new, aggressive wave of Covid-19 and a Japanese public that remained uninterested to the end in the role of host.

title: Invasive Insects and Plants Spread Northward
summary: Resume Subscription. Chris Steigerwald saw the browning tops of the pitch pines and hiked toward them for a closer look. As he drew near, the New York forester said he saw tree trunks marked with hundreds of oozing, popcorn-like defects-evidence the trees were infested by a tiny beetle with a big appetite for pine.

title: Gold as an Inflation Hedge: What the Past 50 Years Teaches Us
summary: On the anniversary of the metal's unleashing by Nixon, gold's believers may be disappointed by the record. On a Sunday evening 50 years ago-on Aug. 15, 1971, to be exact-then-President Nixon interrupted "Bonanza," one of the most popular TV shows of that era, to announce that he was ending the convertibility of the U.S. dollar into gold. Many consider it to be one of the most consequential decisions he made.

title: Team USA's Tokyo Olympics Medal Tally: Women Soar, Men Sink
summary: The U.S. won the overall and gold-medal count at the Games and had few Covid-19 cases. TOKYO-After a year-long delay to the Tokyo Olympics and during a global pandemic, the women of Team USA rose to the occasion.

title: Kevin Durant Saved USA Basketball. Again.
summary: Resume Subscription. SAITAMA, Japan-Kevin Durant had every reason not to be here.

title: Team USA Wins Seventh Straight Olympic Gold Medal in Women's Basketball
summary: Resume Subscription. SAITAMA, Japan-They might not have had a branded nickname like "The Dream Team" for these Olympics, but Team USA's women's basketball team was nothing short of dominant in Tokyo-and they finished the job with typical authority on Sunday.

title: Rising Rents Pose Risks to the Fed's Inflation Outlook
summary: Housing costs play an important role in inflation, which means that higher rents could put pressure on the Fed to raise interest rates. The biggest wildcard for U.S. inflation over the next year doesn't come from used cars or airline fares. Instead, it is housing.

title: Neighbors' Deaths From Covid-19 Have Arkansas Town Reassessing Vaccines
summary: Resume Subscription. GREENWOOD, Arkansas-Michael Lejong fully intended to get vaccinated for Covid-19, his wife said, standing in the pavilion that the prominent architect designed for his hometown.

title: Renewables Are Fast Replacing Coal, Except in Rural America
summary: Resume Subscription. U.S. utilities are moving to replace coal plants with renewable-energy sources, but the shift is happening more slowly at the cooperatives that serve much of rural America.

title: U.K. Led the World in Slashing Carbon Emissions. Now Comes the Hard Part.
summary: Britain has made deeper emission cuts than most major economies. How it fares on further reductions will offer clues to the U.S. and other countries.. The U.K. has set one of the most ambitious carbon emission-reduction targets among major economies, making the country a case study in how climate goals call for big shifts in policy, the economy and technology.

title: When Amazon Customers Leave Negative Reviews, Some Sellers Hunt Them Down
summary: Don't share personal information in reviews or with Amazon sellers; save messages in case you decide to report them. Ever wonder how cheap, no-name products on Amazon can amass hundreds, sometimes thousands, of nearly perfect star ratings, with just a handful of negative reviews?

title: To Beat Tesla, Volkswagen Bets on Making Its Own EV Batteries
summary: VW's foray into battery production shows the difficulties incumbent auto makers face as they try to make money in electric vehicles. SALZGITTER, Germany-Many of the world's traditional auto makers are racing to develop their own batteries for electric cars, embracing a strategy that helped turn Tesla Inc. into the market's biggest player.

title: Infrastructure Bill's Boost to Economy Is Likely to Be Limited
summary: Economists say the short-term economic lift will be minimal, though bill may generate long-term productivity gains. WASHINGTON-The bipartisan infrastructure bill is unlikely to have a big impact on growth in the next few years, economists say. Longer term, though, investments in highways, ports and broadband could make the economy more efficient and productive.

title: Beijing's Attempts to Destress Schooling Sparks Its Own Angst
summary: Beijing's education overhaul, which aims to ease intense competition, turns life upside-down for anxious parents. BEIJING-New limits on for-profit education services imposed by the Chinese government are upending the carefully laid plans of millions of parents-liberating some from what they have come to regard as a money-draining competition, while driving others to find new, more expensive ways to give their kids a leg up.

title: Record Pace for Corporate Earnings Keeps Stocks Buoyant
summary: Share of firms beating analyst expectations is set for best showing ever, quelling worries for now about Covid-19 variants, stretched valuations. A solid corporate earnings season has bolstered the case for stocks.

title: Eliud Kipchoge Wins Olympic Marathon Again, This Time in Tokyo
summary: Resume Subscription. TOKYO-Eliud Kipchoge delivered a dominating performance in the Tokyo Olympics men's marathon, pulling away from his competition after the halfway point and finishing 1 minute, 20 seconds ahead of second-place finisher Abdi Nageeye of the Netherlands on a steamy day in Sapporo, Japan.
